# The Modules Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Modules represent the top-level structure in an LLVM program. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Modules represent the top-level structure in an LLVM program.

An LLVM module is effectively a translation unit or a collection of translation units merged together.

<SectionDefinition>

Obtain the named metadata operands for a module.

The passed <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> pointer should refer to an array of <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> at least LLVMGetNamedMetadataNumOperands long. This array will be populated with the <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> instances. Each instance corresponds to a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">llvm::MDNode</a>.

### LLVMModuleCreateWithName() {#ga8cf6711b9359fb55d081bfc5e664370c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMModuleRef LLVMModuleCreateWithName (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; ModuleID)</>}>
Create a new, empty module in the global context.

This is equivalent to calling LLVMModuleCreateWithNameInContext with <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmccorecontext/#ga0055cde9a9b2497b332d639d8844a810">LLVMGetGlobalContext()</a> as the context parameter.

Every invocation should be paired with <a href="#ga4acadb366d5ff0405371508ca741a5bf">LLVMDisposeModule()</a> or memory will be leaked.
